action.action-desc: Mr. Casey (for himself, Ms. Collins, Mr. Markey, Mr. Johanns, Mr. Isakson, and Mr. Brown) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Expressing support for the goals and ideals of Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week.

whereas.text: Whereas multiple sclerosis (MS) can impact people of all ages, races, and ethnicities;
Whereas MS is 2 to 3 times more common in women than in men;
Whereas worldwide, there are approximately 2,300,000 people who have been diagnosed with MS;
Whereas MS is an unpredictable neurological disease that interrupts the flow of information within the brain and between the brain and the rest of the body;
Whereas there is no single laboratory test available that provides a definitive diagnosis for MS;
Whereas the exact cause of MS is still unknown, and there is no cure;

Whereas the goals of Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week are to invite people to join the movement to end MS, encourage people to demonstrate their commitment to moving toward a world free from MS, and acknowledge those who have dedicated their time and talent to advancing MS research and programs; and
Whereas this year Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week is being recognized during the week of March 3, 2014, through March 9, 2014: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: supports the goals and ideals of Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week;
supports promoting awareness of individuals who are affected by multiple sclerosis;

encourages States, localities, and the territories and possessions of the United States to support the goals and ideals of Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week by issuing proclamations designating March 3, 2014, through March 9, 2014, as Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week;
encourages media organizations to participate in Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week by educating the public about multiple sclerosis;
recognizes and reaffirms the commitment of the United States to ending multiple sclerosis by supporting multiple sclerosis research and education programs;
supports all individuals in the United States living with multiple sclerosis;
expresses gratitude to the family and friends of individuals living with multiple sclerosis, who are a source of love and encouragement to those individuals; and
salutes the health care professionals and medical researchers who—

subparagraph.text: provide assistance to individuals affected by multiple sclerosis; and
continue to work towards finding new ways to stop the progression of the disease, treat its symptoms, and end multiple sclerosis forever.
